title: Quiz 9: Counselling Special Groups - HIV/AIDS
description: Assess knowledge on HIV/AIDS counselling protocols, medical management, and palliative care.

questions.question: Which of the following are reasons for Pre-HIV test counselling? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Assess the patient's ability to cope with results

questions.explanation: Pre-test counselling is about preparation and consent, not immediate treatment.

questions.question: Order the steps of GATHER in the context of HIV counselling:
Match the medication to the condition it treats in HIV patients:
questions.explanation: AZT targets the virus; Nystatin targets fungus; Acyclovir targets herpes; Imodium targets symptoms.

questions.question: When counselling a terminally ill patient, if they try to set unrealistic goals to prolong life, which stage of termination are they in?
questions.explanation: Bargaining involves trying to negotiate or change the outcome through unrealistic means.

questions.question: HIV can be transmitted by handling body fluids of infected people without gloves.
questions.explanation: Unprotected contact with infected body fluids is a transmission route.

questions.question: Dietary advice for an HIV patient with diarrhoea should include: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Fluids prevent dehydration. Fats and milk can worsen diarrhoea.

questions.question: Pruritic papules often occur in warm areas of the body such as the ___BLANK___ and pubic area.
questions.explanation: Pruritic (itchy) papules favour warm, moist areas like armpits.

questions.question: What is the final stage of termination/grief where the patient plans ways of coping independently?
questions.explanation: Acceptance is the final stage where reality is acknowledged and peace is found.

questions.question: Why is it important to discuss 'unfinished business' with a terminally ill patient?

options.text: To settle debts and prepare for a peaceful death
To ensure they pay the hospital bill

questions.explanation: Resolving unfinished business (debts, wills, conflicts) provides psychological peace.

questions.question: A patient testing positive for HIV should be advised to:
questions.explanation: Preventing transmission via condoms is critical. Work can usually continue.
